alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 23 at 6:01PM CST until December 23 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Glasscock County in western Texas... Northeastern Midland County in western Texas... Southwestern Howard County in western Texas... Southeastern Martin County in western Texas... * Until 645 PM CST. * At 600 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles southwest of Greenwood, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Midland, Greenwood, Stanton, Lomax, Cotton Flat, Elbow, Skywest Airport, and Spraberry. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 138 and 142, and between mile markers 149 and 172. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
